poem:
**Collision Course**

In Prague, a shadowed dance,  
steel whispers on cobblestones,  
politics swerves like  
a phantom of intention—  
Hsiao strides unyielding,  
while whispers curl like  
old smoke on the Vltava,  
telling tales of futures  
that never clash,  
only glance past  
as quiet warnings  
etched in muted echoes.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "China ‘planned car collision’ during Taiwan vice-president’s visit to Prague Taiwan’s vice-president has said she will not be intimidated after reports by Czech intelligence that Chinese officials planned to stage a car collision when she was in Prague last year. Hsiao Bi-khim visited the Czech Republic in March 2024, in the first overseas visit by her and Taiwan’s president, Lai Ching-te, after winning the election in January.
